response.answer_text: A very little, the FCC has a standard and each phone must pass it. Phones have gotten better over the years and emit way less radiation than before. Do you remember in the 2000's when cellphones would make a loud buzzing noise from the speakers inside a car? That doesn't happen anymore. So smartphone manufacturers are careful because hurting people would be the end of their company, so they perform all sorts of tests to make sure it's safe, sometimes they use rats as test subjects. Ask a scientist, don't get your information from some guy on the internet.

Yes, as do lightbulbs, TVs, cookers and hobs, wires in the walls, radios, the sun, many igneus rocks, etc. Its not a question of do they emit it but rather do they emit danherous types/levels of it and the answer there is no they dont.
Bob Myers's answer to Do all electronic devices emit radiation?
